Package view

Class MinesweeperGUIView

java.lang.Object
javafx.application.Application
view.MinesweeperGUIView
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Observer
public class MinesweeperGUIView
extends javafx.application.Application
implements java.util.Observer
This file contains GUI component of the application for Minesweeper. It initializes the interface of the game and allows the user to interact with it. It represents the minefield with a GridPane of ToggleButtons that the user can left or right click on to take steps or toggle flags respectively. There are several animations and alerts that can occur throughout the game depending on the user's actions.
Author:
Eleanor Simon, Giang Huong Pham, Tanmay Agrawal, Katherine Wilson

  • Constructor Details

    • MinesweeperGUIView

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
      Starts the GUI-based view of the Minesweeper game. Initialized everything needed for the stage and shows it. Also initializes the controller and model needed to manage the gameplay state. If valid command-line arguments were provided by the player in the launcher, then a minefield will be displayed according to the measurements and number of mines that were specified.
      Specified by:
      start in class javafx.application.Application
      Parameters:
      primaryStage - Stage that is displayed to the user over the course of gameplay.

    • update

      public void update​(java.util.Observable o, java.lang.Object saveGame)
      This method overrides the update method in the observer. Depending on the progress made in the game, different elements of the GUI will be updated to reflect the changes in game state as a result of the player's actions.
      Specified by:
      update in interface java.util.Observer
      Parameters:
      o - Observable object, in this case, the game model.
      saveGame - (expected to be boolean) tells whether or not to save the game the game should be saved when game is not Over.

    • initGame

      private void initGame​(int length, int width, int numberOfMines)
      This method initializes the game on launch. It checks for save files from previous uncompleted games and loads them if they are found.
      Parameters:
      length - integer representing the length of the board
      width - integer representing the width of the board
      numberOfMines - integer representing the number of the mines hidden on the board

    • setlabel

      private javafx.scene.control.ToggleButton[][] setlabel​(int x, int y, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane)
      This method initializes each toggle button in the GridPane and adds them to an ArrayList for accessibility.
      Parameters:
      x - integer representing the width of the mine field.
      y - integer representing the length of the mine field.
      pane - GridPane representing the mine field.
      Returns:
      a 2D array of ToggleButtons displayed in the GridPane.

    • setEventListener

      private void setEventListener​(javafx.scene.control.ToggleButton button, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane pane)
      This method adds necessary event listeners onto the ToggleButton. These event listeners detect left and right clicks. If a left click is made, then a step is taken. If a right click is made, then a flag is toggled. An alert will be shown if the player tries to place a flag when they're out of flags.
      Parameters:
      button - ToggleButton where event is caught.
      pane - GridPane representing the mine field.

    • setImage

      private void setImage​(java.lang.String img, javafx.scene.control.ToggleButton button)
      This method updates the given ToggleButton according to the passed in string: "flag" or "mine".
      Parameters:
      img - a String representing the prefix of the name of the image to be used
      button - the ToggleButton that will contain the image

    • removeFlag

      private void removeFlag​(javafx.scene.control.ToggleButton button)
      Removes the flag image from a button.
      Parameters:
      button - button in which flag is removed from.

    • updateGrid

      private void updateGrid​(boolean revealMine, Space[][] spaceGrid, boolean playerWon)
      This method updates the GridPane of ToggleButton
      Parameters:
      revealMine - boolean to tell whether to show the mine on the map or not.
      spaceGrid - Space[][] representing the underlying mine map.
      playerWon - true if the player found all the mine, false otherwise

    • waveAnimation

      private void waveAnimation​(javafx.scene.Node toWave, javafx.util.Duration timeLimit)
      Creates a waving animation on a node. Takes a node and a time as parameters that are used to add wave-like movements to the given node.
      Parameters:
      toWave - JavaFX Node to wave.
      timeLimit - the duration of the animation.

    • shakeAnimation

      private void shakeAnimation​(javafx.scene.Node toShake, javafx.util.Duration timeLimit)
      Creates a longer shaking animation on a node. This shakes the node horizontally for 1000 cycles.
      Parameters:
      toShake - JavaFX Node to shake.
      timeLimit - the duration of the animation.

    • quickShake

      private void quickShake​(javafx.scene.Node toShake, javafx.util.Duration timeLimit)
      Creates a quick shaking animation on a node. This quickly shakes the node horizontally for 12 cycles.
      Parameters:
      toShake - JavaFX Node to shake.
      timeLimit - the duration of the animation.

    • placeAnimation

      private void placeAnimation​(javafx.scene.Node toMove, javafx.util.Duration time)
      Creates an animation when a flag is placed.
      Parameters:
      toMove - a JavaFX Node.
      time - the duration of the animation.

    • startTime

      private void startTime()
      This method basically is used to update time in the background by prompting the controller to set a chain of events that update time every second.
